message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to make a fair deal. I'm starting with an offer of $180. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice! I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Can you consider that?
Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $120. I'm willing to meet you halfway, though. I'm offering $150. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice. However, I'm still looking to save some more. I'm willing to go up to $130. Can you consider that?

I understand you're trying to save some more, Bob. I'm willing to compromise again. I'm offering $140. It's getting close to my minimum, but I'm willing to make one more concession. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. However, I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to go up to $135. Can you consider that?
I understand you're getting close to your target, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'm offering $145. It's my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. What do you think?
I appreciate your final offer, Alice. However, I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to go up to $140. Can you reconsider?

I'm not willing to budge any further, Bob. I've already made significant concessions. I'm sticking to my final offer of $145. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.

I understand that you're not willing to budge any further, Alice. I appreciate your honesty. However, I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to go up to $142. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options, including buying from John for $150.
